Uses of Interface
org.strongback.components.Clock

  • Packages that use Clock 
    Package Description
    org.strongback  
    org.strongback.components
    This package defines a set of components that mirror real actuator, sensors, and other devices.
    org.strongback.util  

    • Uses of Clock in org.strongback

      Methods in org.strongback that return Clock 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Clock Strongback.timeSystem()
      Get Strongback's time system implementation.
      Methods in org.strongback with parameters of type Clock 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Strongback.Configurator Strongback.Configurator.useCustomTime(Clock clock)
      Determine the time using a custom Clock implementation.

    • Uses of Clock in org.strongback.components

      Methods in org.strongback.components that return Clock 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Clock Clock.fpga()
      Create a new time system that uses the FPGA clock.
      static Clock Clock.fpgaOrSystem()
      Create a new time system that uses the FPGA clock if it is available, or the JRE's time system if not.
      static Clock Clock.system()
      Create a new time system that uses the JRE's System clock.
      Methods in org.strongback.components with parameters of type Clock 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Fuse Fuse.autoResetting(long delay, TimeUnit unit, Clock clock)
      Create a fuse that can be manually Fuse.reset() but that will automatically reset after the given delay.
      static Fuse Fuse.autoResetting(long delay, TimeUnit unit, Clock clock, Runnable whenTriggered)
      Create a fuse that can be manually Fuse.reset() but that will automatically reset after the given delay.

    • Uses of Clock in org.strongback.util

      Methods in org.strongback.util with parameters of type Clock 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Metronome Metronome.busy(long period, TimeUnit unit, Clock timeSystem)
      Create a new metronome that starts ticking immediately and that uses a busy loop to keep the thread active and works on every platform.
      static Metronome Metronome.parker(long period, TimeUnit unit, Clock timeSystem)
      Create a new metronome that starts ticking immediately and that uses LockSupport.parkNanos(long) to wait.
      static Metronome Metronome.sleeper(long period, TimeUnit unit, Clock timeSystem)
      Create a new metronome that starts ticking immediately and that uses Thread.sleep(long) to wait.
